metadata.title: CVE-2024-21144 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Vulnerability in the Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Editionproduct of Oracle Java SE (component: Concurrency).  Supported versionsthat are affected are Oracle Java SE: 8u411, 8u411-perf, 11.0.23; OracleGraalVM Enterprise Edition: 20.3.14 and  21.3.10. Difficult to exploitvulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with network access viamultiple protocols to compromise Oracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM EnterpriseEdition.  Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result inunauthorized ability to cause a partial denial of service (partial DOS) ofOracle Java SE, Oracle GraalVM Enterprise Edition. Note: This vulnerabilityapplies to Java deployments, typically in clients running sandboxed JavaWeb Start applications or sandboxed Java applets, that load and rununtrusted code (e.g., code that comes from the internet) and rely on theJava sandbox for security. This vulnerability does not apply to Javadeployments, typically in servers, that load and run only trusted code(e.g., code installed by an administrator). CVSS 3.1 Base Score 3.7(Availability impacts).  CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:L).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-21144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-jre - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-jre-jamvm - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
openjdk-8-source - 8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8u432-ga~us1-0ubuntu2~16.04.4').
openjdk-9: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no longer supported by upstream').
